snippet: At a forum to discuss electing a female president, the discussion centered on why Hillary Rodham Clinton should return to a state that proved unwelcoming in the past.
abstract: Political Memo; discussion at Des Moines forum conferring about electing a woman president centers on reasons why Hillary Clinton should return to a state that in the past has proved so unwelcoming to her and her family; Democratic strategists from Iowa, which has never elected a female governor, senator or member of the House,  claim state is 'more than ready' to support women candidates.
lead_paragraph: At a forum to discuss electing a female president, the discussion centered on why Hillary Rodham Clinton should return to a state that proved unwelcoming in the past.

headline.main: In Iowa, Hopes That a Clinton Can Close a Gap
headline.print_headline: In Iowa, Hopes That a Clinton Can Close a Gap
